duties_responsibilities.duty: Performing laboratory assays in accordance with standard operation procedures.
Operating, calibrating, and maintaining all laboratory equipment and instruments according to standard operating procedures.
Maintaining adequate inventory of supplies, reagents, and materials.
Accepting or rejecting test results in accordance with standard operating procedures.
Documenting remedial action, troubleshooting, quality assurance activities, and instrument maintenance.
Performing blood banking ( A, B, O and Rh blood typing), chemistry, and molecular testing.
Following laboratory procedures for specimen handling and processing, test analyses, reporting, and maintaining records of patient results.
Accurately entering results of testing and reviewing reports to monitor accurate reporting of results.
Documenting all corrective actions taken when test systems deviate from the laboratory’s established performance specification.
Promptly and courteously answering the phone and assisting clients with their inquiries.
Other duties as assigned by management.

education_certification.credential: BS or BA in biological, clinical laboratory science, or related life science.
Current California Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS) License.
